current.product_tab_payment_desc:
Dust or wipe clean with a cloth dampened with water once a week. Be sure not to leave water spots on the surface. These water spots will dry and could possibly leave permanent marks.

Clean stains/spots using the following steps: Dampen a soft cloth with a mixture of hot water and liquid dishwashing detergent. Wring the cloth as much as possible to remove excess liquid. Rub the surface lightly in a circular motion. Dry the surface immediately with a clean, soft towel.
current.product_tab_payment_content:
Payment Information

Dust or wipe clean with a cloth dampened with water once a week. Be sure not to leave water spots on the surface. These water spots will dry and could possibly leave permanent marks.

Clean stains/spots using the following steps: Dampen a soft cloth with a mixture of hot water and liquid dishwashing detergent. Wring the cloth as much as possible to remove excess liquid. Rub the surface lightly in a circular motion. Dry the surface immediately with a clean, soft towel.

settings.title: Who knew the hedgerows could taste so good?
Sustainability and nature are at the heart of our business.
Sloemotion Distillery
settings.caption:
Founded in 2002, Sloemotion Distillery is an artisan spirits business based at Green Farm, in the village of Barton-le-Willows, just north of York and near to the market town of Malton, Yorkshire’s Food Capital. The company began as the result of wildlife conservation work and continues with a strong ethos of minimising impacts on the environment and helping nature.

To read more about Who We Are, click here

settings.title: Our Ethos
settings.caption:
With Sloemotion founder, Joff Curtoys’ background as a conservationist and ecologist, from the beginning the ethos at Sloemotion has been one of respect for the environment and the wildlife that lives there.

At our aptly named Green Farm headquarters, based in the tranquil village of Barton-le-Willows, in the rolling countryside of North Yorkshire, to minimise energy use, re-cycle, re-use, re-purpose and conserve is second nature to us; it’s what we do.

settings.title: Sustainability
settings.caption: We came from the hedgerows... Sustainability and nature are at the heart of the business

settings.title: Responsible Distilling
settings.caption: 21st Century responsible distilling & traditional steeping... Minimising our impact on the planet and respecting time-honoured methods

settings.title: Re-cycle
settings.caption: Re-cycle, re-purpose and re-use is a mantra we follow every day.

settings.title: Hand Made in Small Batches
settings.caption: Always creating great tasting, beautiful-looking products

settings.title: Our Partners
settings.caption:
As the business has grown Sloemotion Distillery is proud to have formed partnerships with significant and well established companies around the UK.

We have been supplying product to Waitrose and Booths supermarkets for over 10 years and more recently the Wine Society, Liberty of London, Berry Bros. & Rudd, Corney & Barrow and Co-op. We have worked with over 400 farm shops, food halls, garden centres & delis.

settings.detail_caption:
For your safety and the safety of the Sloemotion Team, visits to Green Farm are by appointment only. We sell nationwide in a great number of farmshops, foodhalls and garden centres; please see our full list of stockists

settings.title: Sloemotion Distillery Mission Statement
settings.caption: We believe in doing things in the right way, using traditional methods combined with modern energy-saving techniques to bring great tasting, craft distilled spirits and liqueurs to the market, with a strong philosophy of respect for the environment which runs through the heart of the business.

settings.title: 21st Century Responsible Distilling
settings.caption:
The biggest energy usage at any distillery is the still itself. We use the energy-efficient iStill. The iStill’s design, insulation and computer controls means, using up to 10 times less energy than a traditional still, our distillery is always literally (& metaphorically) cool!

Our Head Distiller Ian uses his experience and that of his team to review existing recipes and trial new ideas using our second smaller development iStill.

To find out more about what else we do to minimise our impact on the environment:

settings.title: Foraging
settings.caption: We forage at Green Farm and the surrounding countryside through the seasons for hedgerow fruits and botanicals to use in the creation of our products. Once gathered, we dry or freeze them to preserve and concentrate flavours for the distillation or steeping processes.

settings.title: Traditional Steeping
settings.caption:
The business began by scaling up traditional kitchen recipes and techniques to make quality liqueur products. Today, we still follow those award-winning methods.

The core element of our liqueur making is macerating or steeping whole fruit in small batches over a period of months. This lengthy process, along with regular stirring, allows the product flavour to fully develop and mature.

settings.title: Taste every batch
settings.caption: At the end of the process, every batch is assessed for taste and colour. Joff is the key person for this but we all have to get involved now and again…. Sometimes it sharpens the mind!

settings.title: Second-hand Sloes
settings.caption:
We re-cycle, re-use and re-purpose whatever and wherever we can – we don’t like waste. Our tastiest use of re-purposing comes with our second-hand sloes!

Our skilful team have developed innovative recipes using the gin-soaked sloes (too good to throw away!) to make our unique and award winning Sloe Gin Chocolate Truffles and Sloe Chutney.

Waste not, want not.

To find out more about how we re-purpose, re-cycle and re-use, click the button below:

settings.title: Who We Are
settings.caption:
Founded in 2002, Sloemotion Distillery is an artisan business creating great tasting spirits and liqueurs. We are based at Green Farm, in the village of Barton-le-Willows, just north of York and near to the market town of Malton, Yorkshire’s food capital.

The business began almost by accident, when a farming initiative to improve wildlife habitats resulted in an abundance of sloes. To Joff Curtoys, an ecologist by training, who had grown up drinking his father’s home-made Sloe Gin, an idea began to take shape and Sloemotion was born.
settings.special_statement: The fields, rich meadows, woodlands and especially the tangled hedgerows in North Yorkshire provided the inspiration for the business and are still at the heart of every decision made.

settings.title: Spirits are high at Castle Howard.
Introducing our premium gin in partnership with Sloemotion Distillery
Our Founder
settings.caption:
With Joff’s background as a trained farmer/conservationist and then policy advisor on agricultural issues for the RSPB, the ethos and background of Sloemotion is one of respect for the planet.

His passion for wildlife conservation and the environment is ever at the heart of each decision made at the distillery.

settings.title: Our Ethos
settings.caption:
With Sloemotion founder, Joff Curtoys’ background as a conservationist and ecologist, from the beginning the ethos at Sloemotion has been one of respect for the environment and the wildlife that lives there.

At our aptly named Green Farm headquarters, based in the tranquil village of Barton-le-Willows, in the rolling countryside of North Yorkshire, to minimise energy use, re-cycle, re-use, re-purpose and conserve is second nature to us; it’s what we do.

- Liberty of London, who established their very first food hall in 2016. We were delighted to be asked to supply dual branded Sloe Gin & Damson Vodka to them, which continues on today.

- Berry Brothers & Rudd, the oldest wine merchants in the United Kingdom. As well as making a Sloe Gin for them, we supply their St James’ shop with our own spirits.

- Corney & Barrow, we have been making a Sloe Gin for them for the past 8 years.

As well as our national connections, having established ourselves in Yorkshire, we have formed lasting relationships with businesses in what is a huge area with a strong identity. We’re very proud to promote our Yorkshire roots to a very loyal crowd; it’s one of the founding blocks of the business and still continues today. Examples of collaborations include:

- Castle Howard. We are delighted to be teaming up with our close neighbours , only4 miles away, for a number of exciting events as well as creating a collaborative new gin inspired by the rural countryside surrounding their prestigious 8,000acre estate.

- Yorkshire Wildlife Trust. Sloemotion Distillery was born as result of conservation work so teaming up with Yorkshire Wildlife Trust was a natural fit. We launched our first ever limited edition product in 2019 donating money for every bottle sold for the vital work carried out by the trust.

As well as collaborations we also work closely with partner food manufacturers in the region. These include:

- Bettys of Harrogate, the well known baker and café owner has been using our products in their amazing Sloe Gin Cake for over 10 years and our spirits and liqueurs on their café cocktail menus from time to time.

- Rosebud Preserves, who have a very similar ethos relating to the Yorkshire countryside and are fellow foragers, make a delicious Blackberry and Sloe Gin jam using the gin-soaked sloes taken from our Sloe Gin making process.

- Lottie Shaws, established Yorkshire bakers, make wonderful parkin and cakes also use our Sloe Gin in some of their cakes and our Hedgerow Gin in their Gin-iced mince pies.

• Liberty of London, who established their very first food hall in 2016. We were delighted to be asked to supply dual branded Sloe Gin & Damson Vodka to them, which continues on today.
  • Berry Brothers & Rudd, the oldest wine merchants in the United Kingdom. As well as making a Sloe Gin for them, we supply their St James’ shop with our own spirits.
  • Corney & Barrow, we have been making a Sloe Gin for them for the past 8 years.

As well as our national connections, having established ourselves in Yorkshire, we have formed lasting relationships with businesses in what is a huge area with a strong identity. We’re very proud to promote our Yorkshire roots to a very loyal crowd; it’s one of the founding blocks of the business and still continues today. Examples of collaborations include:
  • Castle Howard. We are delighted to be teaming up with our close neighbours , only4 miles away, for a number of exciting events as well as creating a collaborative new gin inspired by the rural countryside surrounding their prestigious 8,000acre estate.
  • Yorkshire Wildlife Trust. Sloemotion Distillery was born as result of conservation work so teaming up with Yorkshire Wildlife Trust was a natural fit. We launched our first ever limited edition product in 2019 donating money for every bottle sold for the vital work carried out by the trust.

settings.title: Yorkshire Roots
settings.caption:
As well as our national connections, having established ourselves in Yorkshire, we have formed lasting relationships with businesses in what is a huge area with a strong identity.

We’re very proud to promote our Yorkshire roots to a very loyal crowd; it’s one of the founding blocks of the business and still continues today.

settings.sub_title: Minimising our impact on the planet is not a marketing fad for us. It's been at the heart of every decision made since the start of the business nearly 20 years ago. It goes on today and every day.........

settings.title: Low Energy Use
settings.sub_title: Our starting point was choosing the most energy efficient still.
settings.caption:
• So, we chose an iStill which uses up to 5x less energy than a traditional copper still. This is 21st century, responsible distilling.

• Most distilleries are hot with wasted energy “leaking” from the still. The iStill’s design, insulation and computer controls means our distillery is always cool, literally & metaphorically!

settings.title: Wildlife
settings.caption:
• The business began when we stopped cutting hedges annually to help wildlife. We then found lots of sloes all over the farm’s hedges and the idea for the business began.

• As sloes can only grow on wildlife-friendly hedges, by buying more sloes we get more wildlife-friendly hedges!

• We have planted flower-rich micro meadows wherever we can around our buildings to help bees and butterflies

• Founder Joff Curtoys (ecologist/conservationist) works closely with Richard Hudson, who manages Green Farm, to help create wildlife habitats; from wildflower margins, wild bird feed crops, to ponds and woodland.

settings.title: Re-use, Re-purpose or Re-cycle
settings.caption:
• All cardboard is re-used or recycled. The recycling involves composting via farm animal bedding. After the composting it goes back onto the fields here at Green Farm as soil conditioner.

• The botanicals from the gin distillation process are composted and put back into the soil

• Gin-soaked sloes are used in our Sloe Gin Truffles and Sloe Chutney, what aren’t used are composted

• Staff kitchen waste, from tea bags to apple cores, is composted here and all plastics and card is recycled.

• All waste glass is recycled

• We minimise printing and recycle paper used in the office

settings.title: What we use
settings.sub_title: Minimising our carbon-footprint with what we buy
settings.caption:
• We have specially designed packaging to ensure that customers receive products in one piece without the need for any plastic, including the tape.

• Sample cups are made from biodegradable plant starch.

• We only use fully bio-degradable lined-paper or plant starch cups/glasses at pop-up bars.

• We only use paper bags for bottle sales at shows and events. We sell reusable cotton tote bags.

settings.title: About Us
settings.caption: The partnership has been developed out of shared interests between Castle Howard’s estate conservation programme and the ethos of Barton-le-Willows-based Sloemotion, which has pioneered the use of locally foraged botanicals – including sloes and hedgerow fruits - to add to their classic London gin ingredients. The ethos and values that inspired Sloemotion struck a chord with Castle Howard, Joff Curtoys (with a background in ecology and conservation) - one of the brothers behind the Sloemotion brand - sits on the Conservation Advisory Board at Castle Howard, and their work using botanicals sourced from their local surroundings at Green Farm resonated with our wish to develop high quality, sustainable products from the Castle Howard Estate. We are excited to launch the Castle Howard Gin using ingredients foraged from the Estate.

settings.title: Introducing our premium gin.
settings.caption: Castle Howard Gin is a classic juniper led, dry spirit with aromatic extracts of coriander, cardamom, orange peel and St. John’s Wort and further enhanced by tinctures of floral notes from Meadowsweet and sweet sour elements from Crab apple, both foraged from around the estate. Finally, the dry gin finish is accompanied by citrus notes from Lemon Balm, harvested from the wonderful formal gardens

Spirits are high at Castle Howard as the historic Yorkshire estate launches a new premium quality gin in partnership with local business Sloemotion Distillery. Inspired by both the 8000acre estate and the ethos of the distillery, the Castle Howard Gin uses ingredients foraged from across the estate.

The Castle Howard Gin is a classic juniper led, dry spirit with aromatic extracts of coriander, cardamom, orange peel and St. John’s Wort and further enhanced by tinctures of floral notes from Meadowsweet and sweet sour elements from Crab apple, both foraged from across the estate. Finally, the dry gin finish is accompanied by citrus notes from Lemon Balm, harvested from the formal gardens.

"The ethos and values that inspired Sloemotion struck a chord with us here at Castle Howard,” says Nicholas Howard. “Joff Curtoys, Founder of Sloemotion Distillery (with a background in ecology and conservation) who sits on our Conservation Advisory Board, and their work using botanicals sourced from their local surroundings at Green Farm resonated with our wish to develop high quality, sustainable products from the estate here."

The gin partnership has been developed out of shared interests between Castle Howard’s estate conservation programme and the ethos of Barton-le-Willows-based Sloemotion Distillery, which has pioneered the use of locally foraged botanicals – including sloes and hedgerow fruits - to add to their classic London Dry Gin ingredients.

settings.title: Perfect Serve
settings.caption:
Fill a glass with ice

Add 50ml Castle Howard Gin

Pour in a premium tonic (quantity as desired)

Garnish with lemon peel and/or a sprig of lemon balm (optional)

settings.title: Clover Club Cocktail
settings.caption:
Ingredients 6 raspberries muddled 25ml sugar syrup (made with 2 parts sugar, 1 part boiling water) 25ml Lemon juice 50ml Hedgerow Gin with Rhubarb and Raspberry 1 egg white
